channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report E-2023080706
item.description:
Report E-2023080706

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPW experienced a UN3266 Temp Det release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting a 10’ x 30’ area of the trailer floor and adjacent freight due to being crushed by other freight. The damaged pail was placed into a 15-gallon poly drum. Three 15-gallon poly drums of UN2984 hydrogen peroxide “MicroTech Liquid Oxygen Bleach” were impacted by the product and stained, each was placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. A baking soda solution was then utilized to neutralize all impacted surfaces. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into to collect all product and neutralizer. The impacted absorbents, impacted cardboard, and rags were collected and containerized into a supersack. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brough to QA due to leaking powder & was immediately placed in a well ventilated area to await further processing. DescribePack: Both internal containers had punctures & abrasions on the side of their packaging. Size = 1 inch. Location = top of sides before neck. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazmat lined bin to contain any further leaking powder.

  • City: SEATTLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver had completed loading his trailer with gasoline. As the driver disconnected the loading hose, one of the lines remained in an open position. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of gasoline to be released. US Ecology responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report I-2023080008
item.description:
Report I-2023080008

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At DTW, on 6/30/23, a Cargo agent loaded a Dangerous Goods(DG) shipment(UN3082) into the back of a SEMI truck. A second agent was following behind, driving a forklift, with a different shipment. The second agent's forklift tines were sticking out on the other side of the freight and punctured a hole in the DG shipment. The agent pulled the forklift out of the truck tracking the DG into the warehouse. The DG was contained, and the Cargo agent(s) followed instructions detailed in the Emergency Response Guide book. The domestic area was evacuated (employees) for approximately seven hours. Clean Harbor(spill business partner) was contacted and arrived four hours later due to no available cleaning crews in the area. The Airport Authority and the Fire Department determined there was no immediate threat; however, they instructed the team to keep everyone out of the affected area until the spill was cleaned. The cleaning operation completed at 2320.

item.title: Report I-2023060049
item.description:
Report I-2023060049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T00:31:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-25
  • City: ZILLAH
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WILBUR-ELLIS COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While at intersection, a leak was detected from tote, coming from back of truck bed. Free product released to the asphalt roadway and adjacent soil. GrayMar Environmental was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Washington Department of Ecology responded to assess and monitor response. Upon inspection, one 330-gallon tote was discovered cracked, which resulted in the release of approximately 130 gallons of product. GrayMar Environmental proceeded to transfer the remaining product into a recovery tote to prevent further release. GrayMar Environmental used absorbent material on the asphalt roadway and hand shoveled grossly contaminated soil into a stockpile, which was covered with poly, pending return for excavation. GrayMar Environmental returned the following day, excavated contaminated soil, and used a street sweeper to clear residual off the roadway. Disposal was coordinated in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. There were no injuries or exposures.
